rhymes.name: Rain
content: It falls on field and tree,
It rains on the unbrella here,
And on the ships at sea.
rhymes.author: R. L. Stevenson

rhymes.name: O Sailor, Come Ashore!
content: What have you brought for me?
I did not dig it from the groud,
Nor pluck it from a tree;
rhymes.author: C. G. Rossetti

rhymes.name: The Wind
content: But when the leaves hang trembling,
But when the trees bow down their heads,
rhymes.author: C. G. Rossetti

rhymes.name: Colors
content: What is pink? A rose is pink,
What is red? a poppy's red,
What is blue? the sky is blue,
What is white? A swan is white,
What is yellow? Pears are yellow,
What is green? The grass is green,
What is orange? Why, an orange,
rhymes.author: C. G. Rossetti

rhymes.name: What Does Little Birdie Say?
content: In her nest at peep of day?
Let me fly, says little birdie,
Till the little wings are stronger.
So she rests a little longer,
In her bed at peep of day?
Let me rise and fly away.
Till the little limbs are are stronger.
If she sleeps a little longer,
rhymes.author: Alfred Tennyson

rhymes.name: The Star
content: How I wonder what you are,
Up above the world so high,
Like a diamond in the sky.
When the blazing sun is gone,
Then you show your little light,
The dark blue sky you keep,
And often thro' my curtains peep,
For you never shut your eye,
Till the sun is in the sky.
Tis your bright and tiny spark,
Lights the traveler in the dark,
Though I know not what you are,
rhymes.author: Jane Taylor

rhymes.name: At The Seaside
content: When I was down beside the sea,
A wooden spade they gave to me,
The holes were empty like a cup,
In every hole the sea camp up,
Till it could come no more.
rhymes.author: R. L. Stevenson

rhymes.name: Boats Sail On The Rivers
content: And ships sail on the seas,
But clouds that sail across the sky,
There are bridges on the river,
But the bow that bridges heaven,
And builds a road from earth to sky,
rhymes.author: C. G. Rossetti

rhymes.name: The Swing
content: How do you like to go up in a swing,
Up in the air so blue?
Oh, I do think it the pleasantest thing,
Up in the air and over the wall,
Till I can see so wide,
River and trees and cattle and all,
Till I look down on the garden green,
Down on the roof so brown,
Up in the air I go flying again,
Up in the air and down!
rhymes.author: R. L. Stevenson
